content.en: What's an allergy? It's when your body touches something and your body doesn't like it. Your body tries to fight it.
content.tw: 什麼是過敏? 當你的身體接觸到不喜歡的東西時，它會反抗，產生過敏反應。

content.en: People can have allergies to many things - plants, animals, and more.
content.tw: 人們會對許多事物過敏——植物、動物等等。

content.en: Some allergies are not bad. They make you itch. They make you sneeze. But they won't kill you! Some allergies can be very dangerous! People with bad allergies need to be very careful!
content.tw: 有一些過敏反應會讓你皮膚癢、打噴嚏，但是嚴重的過敏反應有一些人要很小心，會很危險。

content.en: Many people have nut allergies. That's why many foods have a special stamp. It says "May Contain Nuts". It's very easy for nuts to get into food. People with nut allergies need to be very, very careful!
content.tw: 有一些食物都有標示含有堅果，對堅果過敏的人要特別小心。

content.en: A woman was on a plane. She had a very bad nut allergy. The crew was selling snacks. Then she saw WHAT the snacks were … peanuts!!! The woman was scared. Her allergy was very bad. She didn't want people on the plane to have peanuts. So she bought all of them! She bought every peanut on the plane!
content.tw: 這個女士很害怕，她不要飛機上的乘客吃到花生，所以把它們全部買下來。

content.en: The woman spent 6,000 Taiwan dollars on peanuts! But she was safe. If you have allergies, be careful!
content.tw: 這位女士花了 6,000 元台幣買花生！但她很安全。如果你有過敏症，請務必小心！

vocabulary.preface: 對花生過敏的女士，買了飛機上所有的花生。

content.text:
1. sneeze 打噴嚏
Oh, my, this is really bad! 這真是糟糕!
I just can't stop sneezing. 我打噴嚏打個不停。
Is it because of the cold air? 是因為冷空氣嗎?
Probably.可能是。

2. itch 癢
My nose itches and I've got red eyes. 我鼻子癢，還有紅眼睛。
You need to take some medicine. 你需要吃一點藥。

3. spend 花費。
I did. I just spent 600 NT on allergy medicines.
我吃了，剛剛才花了六百塊買過敏藥。
That should take care of it. 那應該可以對付了。

4. fight 對抗。
I wish I could fight it without medicine. 我希望不吃藥就可以對抗。
Get more sleep. That usually helps. 多睡一點，通常很有幫助。

vocabulary.postscript:
These are useful words.
sneeze打噴嚏
itch癢
spend花費
fight對抗

2. What was the crew selling?
3. How much did the woman spend on peanuts?

content.en: What happens in an earthquake? Under our feet, the ground shakes - on the Earth!
What about moonquakes? Yup, the ground shakes on the moon!
content.tw: 發生地震的時候，我們腳下的地球震動。那月震呢? 沒錯，就是月球的地面發生震動!

content.en: Why do moonquakes happen? The moon gets VERY hot during the day. This means it get a little bigger. The moon gets VERY cold at night. It gets a little smaller. The moon changes from hot to cold every afternoon. Moonquakes happen then!
content.tw: 為什麼會發生月震呢? 月球白天非常炎熱，月球會稍微膨脹。而夜晚非常寒冷，月球會因此收縮。每到下午，月球的氣溫從熱到冷，就會發生月震。

content.en: Scientists studied these moonquakes. They found very small moonquakes too. Why do these happen? Well, many years ago, the USA left a big rocket part there...
content.tw: 科學家研究發現月球也會發生一些微小的月震。為什麼會發生呢? 很多年前，美國在月球留下了一大塊的火箭零件。

content.en: It's made of metal. When metal gets very cold, it gets a little smaller. When metal gets very hot, it gets a little bigger. The rocket part changes from cold to hot every morning. Very small moonquakes happen then!
content.tw: 它是金屬做的，金屬會熱脹冷縮。每到早上，火箭零件由冷轉熱，就會發生微小的月震。

content.en: Scientists will take many things to the moon. When the heat and cold change there, what will happen to these things? Scientists will study this. On the moon, big heat and cold changes can make things a little bigger or a little smaller. And they shake the moon!
content.tw: 科學家將帶很多東西到月球。當那裡的熱和冷變化時，這些東西會發生什麼事呢？科學家將研究這個。在月球上，巨大的熱冷變化可以讓物體變大或變小一點。它們還會震動月球！

vocabulary.preface: 地球有地震，月球也有月震，而且是熱脹冷縮造成的。

content.text:
earthquake 地震
What's that? 那是什麼?
Oh no, it's an earthquake! 糟糕，是地震!
Should we run? 我們應該跑嗎?
No, let's hide under the table. 不，來躲到桌子底下。

bigger 更大的
Wow, this one is big! 哇，這個地震好大!
And it's getting bigger! 還更大了。
I wonder what's happening. 我想知道發生了什麼事。

year 年
The TV says it's the biggest earthquake in ten years.
電視上說這是十年來最大的地震。
It's certainly very scary. 真的很嚇人。

shake 震動
My books are all on the floor! 我的書都掉到地上了。
It must be because of the shaking.一定是因為震動的關係。
I was shaking for sure.我剛剛是真的在發抖。

vocabulary.postscript:
Let's read the vocabulary together.
earthquake地震
bigger更大的
year年
shake震動

quiz.question: What happens when the moon gets very hot?
When is the moon very cold?
What makes the very small moonquakes happen?

content.en: People love ordering food online. Food delivery drivers are busy! In India, one delivery driver uses his scooter to deliver food orders. But one day, it needed gas. He went to the gas station.
content.tw: 人們喜歡線上點餐，讓外送員都很忙碌。印度有一位外送員騎機車送訂單。有一天他的機車需要加油，就去了加油站。

content.en: At that time, everyone was worried about gas. Was there enough? Maybe not! So everyone wanted to buy gas. The line at the gas station was very long!
content.tw: 當時大家都很擔心汽油不夠，所以都去買油，讓加油站大排長龍。

content.en: The man waited... three hours! Then he got a new food order. This was a big problem. He didn't want his hungry customer to wait! But his scooter needed gas.
content.tw: 這位外送員一等就是三個小時，但是他有了新訂單，不能讓客人等。

content.en: The man had an idea. He used his friend's horse! He got the food. He put the red delivery bag on his back. Then he rode the horse to deliver the customer's order.
content.tw: 他有個主意，他可以騎朋友的馬送餐! 他騎著馬、揹著紅色外送袋去送客人訂的餐點。

content.en: The road was busy and noisy. But the horse walked calmly.
content.tw: 街道非常吵雜又擁擠，但是馬冷靜地向前走。

content.en: People were amazed to see a delivery driver riding a horse! Some posted pictures online of this unstoppable food delivery driver. He became famous!
content.tw: 路人都很驚訝看到外送員騎馬送訂單，有一些人上傳照片到網路上，讓他一炮而紅。

content.en: His scooter was out of gas, but this delivery driver found a cool way to do his job! Giddyap, horsey!
content.tw: 他的機車沒油了，但這位外送員找到了一個很酷的方法來完成他的工作！駕，小馬！

vocabulary.preface: 騎馬送餐去，真是使命必達。

content.text: 1. famous 著名的 What's that long line for? 那麼長的隊伍在做什麼? Don't you know? That's the famous pancake store. 你不知道嗎?那是有名的鬆餅店。
2. wait 等待 People are lining up for pancakes? 大家為了鬆餅排隊?! Yeah, I once waited one hour standing there. 對啊，我有一次站在那兒等了一個鐘頭。
3. amazed 驚訝的 I'm amazed you'd do something like that. 我很驚訝你會做那種事。 Well, you've never tasted their pancakes. 因為你沒吃過他們的鬆餅。
4. deliver 運送 No, I'm amazed you didn't have it delivered to you. 不，我是驚訝你沒有叫外送。 For pancakes, you have to eat it nice and hot. 鬆餅一定要吃熱呼呼的啊。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天學到哪些單字? famous著名的 wait等待 amazed驚訝的 deliver運送

quiz.question: 1. What is the man's job?
2. How long did the man wait for gas?
3. What was the man's idea?

content.en: Barbers cut people's hair. They work in barbershops.
content.tw: 理髮師幫人剪頭髮，他們在理髮店工作。

content.en: Many people like barbershops. They talk with the barber. They see their friends. They relax and have fun. Oh, and they get a haircut!
content.tw: 很多人喜歡理髮店，可以跟師傅聊天，見見朋友，當然也是為了剪頭髮。

content.en: One day, a teacher went to his barbershop. One of his students came in. But his student didn't have fun. He had nothing to do. He was very bored. He wanted to go!
content.tw: 有一天，一位老師去剪頭髮。他的學生也在那裡。但是這個學生覺得很無聊，想要離開。

content.en: The teacher knew his student. He needed a good book to stop his boredom. Then the teacher had a great idea!
content.tw: 老師知道他的學生需要看書才不會無聊。他想到一個好點子!

content.en: The teacher gave his barbershop many good kids' books. The books were free - and fun! He wanted kids to read at the barbershop. He wanted kids to like reading. And great news! His idea worked very well!
content.tw: 他捐了很多童書給理髮店，希望小朋友可以在理髮店看書，也從此喜歡看書。

content.en: Now he helps over two hundred barbershops! He gives them fun kids' books. The barbers talk with kids about reading too. They ask "Do you like to read?" and "How is that book?" Kids like reading and talking about books there!
content.tw: 現在他已經幫助了兩百多家理髮店！他捐贈有趣的兒童讀物給他們。理髮師們也會和小朋友們談論閱讀。他們會問：「你喜歡閱讀嗎？」和「這本書怎麼樣？」孩子們喜歡在那裡閱讀和談論書籍！

vocabulary.preface: 到理髮店剪頭髮，順便看故事書，很棒的主意!

content.text:
1. haircut 剪頭髮
Hey, you got a new haircut! 嘿，你剪了新髮型!
Looks great on you! 很好看呢!
Really? I did it yesterday. 真的喔? 我昨天剪的。
I'm still not sure if I like it. 我還不確定喜不喜歡。

2. bored 厭煩
So you were just bored with your old look? 所以你就是厭煩了老樣子?
Yeah, I got all sweaty with my long hair. 對啊，長頭髮讓我流好多汗。

3. free 免費的
But the best thing is my haircut was free! 最棒的是，我剪頭髮是免費的。
How is that possible? 怎麼可能?
A free haircut in Taipei? 在台北免費剪頭髮?

4. great 很棒的
It's true! 真的啊。Isn't it great? 不是很棒嗎?
I won a gift voucher in a lucky draw.我在幸運抽獎時抽中了禮券。

vocabulary.postscript:
還記得今天學到哪些單字嗎?
haircut剪頭髮
bored厭煩
free免費的
great很棒的

quiz.question: 1. Who works in a barbershop?
2. What did the student need to stop his boredom?
3. How many barbershops is the teacher helping?

title: Young Amis People Keep the Amis Ways Alive

content.en: In Guangfu Township in Hualien, there is a very old village. It's Taibalang Tribal Village. People of the Amis tribe live there.
content.tw: 花蓮光復的太巴塱（ㄌㄤˇ）部落中住著許多阿美族人。

content.en: The village is next to two rivers. They are full of crabs!
content.tw: 部落旁有兩條河，河中很多螃蟹。

content.en: In the Amis language, "Taibalang" means "crab." The village was named for the crabs in the rivers.
content.tw: 在阿美族語中，太巴塱就是螃蟹的意思。這就是太巴塱部落名字的起源。

content.en: Taibalang has many old wood carvings. These are pictures cut into wood. There are many carvings of crabs!
content.tw: 太巴塱有很多古老的木雕，而且螃蟹圖案的木雕特別多！

content.en: There are also carvings of other animals and people. The people are hunting, fishing, and dancing! The carvings show the ways of the Amis people.
content.tw: 木雕上除了會出現各種動物之外，也會有阿美族人豐富的日常生活！

content.en: Many young people leave the village to work. But every summer, they come back. They help the village get ready for a big festival!
content.tw: 離開部落工作的年輕人會在夏天回來，一起幫忙舉辦祭典。

content.en: Elders teach young people how to help. Everyone has a job to do. They do things the Amis way. Helping the village keeps the ways of the Amis people alive.
content.tw: 部落的長輩負責傳授經驗。這樣子，來幫忙的年輕人才能將阿美族的傳統延續下去。

content.en: Taiwan had some big typhoons this year. Guangfu was flooded. Amis people are going back to help the villages there. Others from all over Taiwan are going too.
content.tw: 今年 ，台灣遭遇了幾次的大颱風。光復被水淹了。阿美族人和來自台灣各地的其他人都去幫助村子！

content.en: Guangfu needs our help now! Let's hope Guangfu gets back to normal soon.
content.tw: 光復現在需要我們的幫助！讓我們希望光復能盡快恢復正常。

vocabulary.preface: 阿美族太巴塱部落，很希望維繫他們的傳統。

content.text:
1. way 方式。
Living in an old village by the river…. 住在河邊的古老村落裡...
Isn't that a nice way of living? 那不是很好的生活方式?

2. hunt 打獵。
I don't know about that. 這我不知道。
People there hunt rabbits and catch crabs?那裏的人獵殺兔子，吃螃蟹?
Why not? 為什麼不可以?

3. young 年輕的。
And older people can teach the young how to do things. 年紀大的可以教導年輕人做事情。
What kinds of things? 做怎樣的事?

4. wood 木頭。
Like…how to make a boat with wood. 比如說怎麼樣用木頭來造船。
So where's this village of yours? 所以你這個村落在哪裡?
I have yet to find it. 我還在找。

vocabulary.postscript: Let's go visit Taibalang Tribe together! 來讀今天的單字。way方式 hunt打獵 young年輕的 wood木頭

quiz.question: 1. What does "Taibalang" mean in Amis language?
2. Where is Taibalang Tribal Village?
3. What are "wood carvings"?

content.en: Big whales swim very far. Every year, they go from cold places to warm places.
content.tw: 鯨魚每年都會從冷的地方游到溫暖海域。

content.en: Some scientists say whales are the gardeners of the ocean. Gardeners grow flowers or food. But how can whales be gardeners?
content.tw: 科學家說，鯨魚就像海洋的園丁一樣。為什麼呢？

content.en: Cold places have lots of very small fish. Whales eat and eat and eat them. Then the whales can swim very far. They swim to warm places.
content.tw: 鯨魚會在冰冷海水中吃很多很多小魚，然後再游到溫暖的地方。

content.en: The warm places don't have lots of small fish. There's not a lot of food for the fish. But that's okay for the whales. They don't eat there. They are busy with their babies.
content.tw: 溫暖的海水沒有小魚吃。不過沒關係，因為鯨魚會在那裏繁殖！

content.en: Oh! The warm water under a whale is turning yellow… But don't say, "EWWWW." There's great food in the water now. Whales make lots of it. Scientists say whales make about four million kilograms of this food every year!
content.tw: 鯨魚底下的水變得黃黃的！那是鯨魚的排泄物，也是一種食物。鯨魚每年會製造四百萬公斤這種食物！

content.en: What happens to this food? Plankton use it! They are very, very small plants and animals. And plankton are very important food for small fish and whales! Whales help the ocean stay full of life. That's why they're called the gardeners of the ocean!
content.tw: 這些食物會怎麼樣呢？浮游生物會利用它們！牠們是非常非常小的植物和動物。浮游生物對小魚和鯨魚來說是非常重要的食物！鯨魚幫助海洋維持生機。這就是牠們被稱為海洋園丁的原因！

vocabulary.preface: 鯨魚在大海中遷徙，也幫助維持生態。

content.text: 1. million 百萬。Did you know that a whale can eat a million tiny fish in one day?你知不知道鯨魚一天就吃掉百萬隻小魚？No, I didn't. 我不知道。But whales are big animals. 不過鯨魚是很大的動物。
2. kilogram 公斤。That's true. 沒錯。A sperm whale can weigh some 55-thousand kilograms.抹香鯨可以重達五萬五千公斤!Wow, that's too heavy! 哇，那太重了!
3. swim 游泳。No, they need the fat. 不，牠們需要脂肪。After all, they have to swim across vast oceans. 畢竟牠們必須游過大洋。
4. very far 很遙遠。That sounds very far. 聽起來很遠呢!Yeah, it is far. 是很遠。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。million百萬 kilogram公斤 swim游泳 very far很遙遠

quiz.question: 1. Where do whales eat lots of small fish?
2. How many kilograms of food do whales make?
3. What are plankton?
options: b. Very small plants and animals

content.en: It was late at night. Somewhere in Taichung, people were sleeping. P.U.!! There was a new, strong, bad smell. People woke up! They smelled it in their houses. They smelled it out on the street. The smell was everywhere!
content.tw: 某一天晚上，一群台中居民從睡夢中驚醒。他們聞到一股奇怪的臭味！

content.en: People thought the smell was cooking gas. It's dangerous! So they called the firemen!
content.tw: 他們以為是瓦斯外洩，所以立刻打電話給消防隊！

content.en: Fire trucks zoomed down the street. Their sirens went "woop woop!" Their lights flashed! Eight firemen jumped out.
content.tw: 一收到通知，消防車跟消防隊員便快速趕到現場。

content.en: Where was the smell coming from? The firemen needed to find out. They knocked on doors. They sniffed. They used a machine that looks for gas. But they did not find any gas.
content.tw: 消防員到處尋找臭味的來源。但即使用了瓦斯偵測器，也沒找到瓦斯味從哪裡來。

content.en: The firemen sniffed and sniffed. Finally, they found where the smell was coming from. It was coming from something on a scooter!
content.tw: 他們聞了好久才發現，臭味是從一台機車散發出來的！

content.en: What was making the bad smell? It was a durian!
content.tw: 原來臭味的源頭是一顆榴槤！

content.en: The durian is called the king of fruits. It is delicious! But it is very smelly! It smells like cooking gas!
content.tw: 榴槤很美味，但也很臭。它的味道聞起來跟瓦斯一樣！

content.en: Everyone saw the durian. What a surprise! They laughed. It was not dangerous. It was a smelly, smelly durian!
content.tw: 大家看到榴槤後都感到很驚訝，然後笑了出來。原來這不是危險的瓦斯外洩，只是一顆又臭又香的榴槤！

vocabulary.preface: 榴槤讓人以為是瓦斯漏氣了。

content.text:
1. everywhere 到處。
What's that smell? 那是什麼氣味? It's everywhere! 到處都是!
I'm pretty sure it's cigarette smoke.我很確定是香菸。

2. street 街道。
Somebody is smoking out on the street.有人在外面街上抽菸。
Oh, I hate that! 真討厭!
Do you want me to yell at him? 你要我對他喊嗎?
No, I'll do it. 不要，我來對他喊。

3. surprise 驚訝。
Hey, hey! Please don't smoke here! 嘿，請你不要在這裡抽菸!
"Sorry!"
Wow, that's a surprise! 哇，真讓我驚訝。

4. look for 尋找。
Indeed, a very polite man. 真的是很有禮貌的人。
We should look for more neighbors like him.我們應該找更多像他那樣的鄰居。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到哪些單字?
everywhere到處 street街道 surprise驚訝 look for尋找

quiz.question: 1. What did people think the bad smell was?
2. How many firemen came to help?
3. Where did the bad smell come from?

title: Team of Teens Gets E-Waste Recycled

content.en: We use many things that need electricity. There are computers, smartphones, TVs, and many more things. When we don't use them anymore, they become e-waste.
content.tw: 我們每天都會用到很多電子產品。電子產品被丟棄就成了電子垃圾。

content.en: Throwing away e-waste makes our land, water, and air dirty. But e-waste can be recycled! Then people can make new things!
content.tw: 電子垃圾會汙染環境，但這些垃圾可以被回收再利用！

content.en: Taiwan is very good at recycling e-waste! But many other places need help.
content.tw: 台灣很會回收電子垃圾喔！

content.en: Dubai is a city in the United Arab Emirates. Like all cities, it has lots of e-waste.
content.tw: 杜拜這個城市位於阿拉伯聯合大公國。他們也有很多電子垃圾。

content.en: A 14-year-old girl helps get Dubai's e-waste recycled. She works with teenagers from six schools.
content.tw: 那裡有個十四歲的女生集合六所學校的學生，一起回收杜拜的電子垃圾。

content.en: The girl and her team ask people for their e-waste. They do this a few times a year. People bring their e-waste to the girl's house. The team sends it to be recycled.
content.tw: 杜拜市民會把電子垃圾帶到這個女生家。接下來，這群學生就會把垃圾送去回收！

content.en: This time, the team got 900 kilograms of e-waste! That's as heavy as two big horses!
content.tw: 他們這一次總共回收了九百公斤的電子垃圾！

content.en: A team of teens is getting e-waste recycled in Dubai! Today is International E-Waste Day. Remember to get your e-waste recycled in Taiwan!
content.tw: 青少年團隊正在杜拜回收電子垃圾！今天是國際電子垃圾日。記得在台灣回收你的電子垃圾！

vocabulary.preface: 手機，電腦之類的產品，裡面很多成分都可以回收再利用。

content.text: 1. team 團隊. My friend's son and his team pick up garbage every weekend. 我朋友的兒子和他的隊伍每個周末都去撿垃圾. On the beach? 去海灘嗎? Yeah. 對.
2. teenager 青少年. How old is he? 他幾歲? Seventeen, I think. 十七歲吧. Teenagers saving the planet. 拯救地球的青少年. That's great! 真棒!
3. school 學校. His school is encouraging it. 他的學校很鼓勵. Of course, it's good for the school and Earth. 當然啦，那對學校跟地球都好.
4. not anymore 不再. We should stop using plastic bags too. 我們也應該停用塑膠袋. Oh, I don't use them anymore. 我都不再用了. Really? 真的嗎?

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎? team團隊 teenager青少年 school學校 not anymore不再

quiz.question: 1. What can become e-waste?
2. Where is Dubai?
3. Where do people in Dubai bring their e-waste?

title: Robots Use AI to Play Soccer

content.en: This summer, six robots ran to a soccer field. They looked like people. They were soccer players!
content.tw: 足球場上有六個機器人，它們是足球選手！

content.en: Each team had three robots. One team wore red shirts. The other team wore blue shirts.
content.tw: 每一隊都有三個機器人，一隊穿著紅色球衣，另一隊穿藍色。

content.en: The whistle blew! The robots started to play! They ran by themselves. People did not help them. The robots used AI to play. Each team had their own AI.
content.tw: 哨聲一響，機器人足球賽就開始了！它們靠著AI自己跑起來，不需要任何人幫忙。

content.en: One robot kicked the ball. One passed the ball to another robot. One robot fell down! But it got up!
content.tw: 一個機器人踢球，另一個傳球，還有一個機器人跌倒後馬上爬起來！

content.en: Another robot fell down. But it did not get up! Two people put it on a stretcher. Then they carried it away.
content.tw: 又有一個機器人跌倒了，但他站不起來！兩個人把它搬上擔架，移到場外。

content.en: Then, one robot made a big kick. GOAL! The other team did not give up. They played hard.
content.tw: 機器人大力一踢，機器人進球了！它的對手沒有放棄，繼續努力比賽。

content.en: The blue team made a goal! The red team scored a goal! The score went up and up! In the end, the blue team had three points. The red team had five points. The red team won! Everyone loved watching the game!
content.tw: 比賽結束，藍隊三分，紅隊五分，紅隊獲勝！真是一場精彩的比賽！

content.en: Robots playing sports is new and fun. Maybe one day robots can play sports with you!
content.tw: 機器人玩運動既新奇又有趣。或許有一天機器人也能和你一起玩運動！

vocabulary.preface: 足球運動很激烈，機器人玩得有模有樣。

content.text:
1. get up 爬起來。
A soccer game? 足球比賽嗎?
Yeah, Germany versus Brazil. 對，德國對巴西。
Wow, this should be a good one! 那應該很精采。
It is. Look how fast that player got up! 是很棒，你看那個球員一下子就爬起來了!

2. kick 踢。
Yeah, he's really playing hard.對啊，他很拚呢。
Hey, just kick the ball, man! 直接踢球啊!

3. team 隊伍。
And they scored! 他們得分了!
What a great team! 厲害的球隊!

4. pass 傳遞。
Did you see how he passed the ball? 你有沒有看到他怎麼傳球?
I did. He's just amazing. 看到了，他很驚人。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀今天的單字。
get up起來 kick踢 team隊伍 pass傳遞

quiz.question: 1. What sport did the robots play?
2. How many robots played in the game?
3. What did the robots use to play the sport?

content.en: Everyone wants an umbrella on rainy days. But did you know umbrellas can have magic? They do in Japan!
content.tw: 你知道在日本雨傘是有魔法的嗎？

content.en: A long time ago, umbrellas were for very important people there. Workers held the umbrellas high over these people! This showed these people had power in their country, or with spirits.
content.tw: 很久以前，在日本只有重要人物才有人幫他們撐傘。這個象徵他們在國內或者在神鬼之間有權有勢。

content.en: So everyone thought umbrellas had magic. They thought spirits came down to Earth and lived in umbrellas!
content.tw: 因此，大家認為雨傘有魔法，神鬼會降臨到世間，住在雨傘裡！

content.en: Today, everyone can use umbrellas. And in Japan, the magic stays!
content.tw: 如今大家都能用傘，但是雨傘在日本的魔力仍然不減！

content.en: At one festival there, people spin beautiful umbrellas. They say these umbrellas take away sickness!
content.tw: 在日本的一個祭典上，大家會旋轉漂亮的雨傘。據說這些雨傘可以帶走病痛！

content.en: At another festival, big floats drive in a parade. The floats have umbrellas on them. People walk under the umbrellas. They say this brings good luck!
content.tw: 另一個祭典會有插滿雨傘的花車。參加祭典的人會從雨傘下走過，祈求平安。

content.en: On one island in Japan, people do a dance every two years. They dance with colorful umbrellas for one night. This helps spirits go home safely!
content.tw: 在日本的一個島上，人們會在某一天晚上拿著色彩繽紛的雨傘跳舞。他們每兩年舉行一次這種舞蹈，希望島上的鬼魂可以平安回家。

content.en: So, when you open an umbrella, look at it. Is it full of magic and good luck too?
content.tw: 所以，當你打開雨傘時，看看它。它也充滿了魔法和好運嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 日本人相信雨傘很神奇，可以帶來好運。

content.text: 1. parade 遊行。 There's a big parade in Keelung this weekend. 這周末基隆有大遊行。 And you plan to go?
2. a long time ago 很久以前。 Yeah, I saw it once a long time ago.對，很久以前我看過一次。
3. think 認為，或是以為。 I thought you don't like crowded places.我以為你不喜歡擁擠的地方。 I don't, but that one was fun.
4. colorful 五顏六色的。 The floats were colorful and beautiful! 花車五顏六色，好漂亮! Some had dancers on them! 有的上面還有人跳舞! I'll go with you.

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎? parade遊行 a long time ago很久以前 think認為，或是以為 colorful五顏六色的

quiz.question: 1. Who were umbrellas for a long time ago in Japan?
2. A long time ago in Japan, where did everyone think spirits lived?
3. Why do people walk under umbrellas at one parade?

title: Taipei Is Making Buses Safer to Ride

content.en: Do you ride the bus? Many people ride the bus. Some ride every day. But, sometimes, bus riders get a surprise.
content.tw: 你平常會搭公車嗎? 有些人天天搭公車，但車上偶爾會發生意外！

content.en: Some bus drivers drive, and then they drive too fast! Hey! Sometimes they stop too fast. Whoa! Both are dangerous to do! Sometimes bus riders fall down. Ouch!
content.tw: 如果公車司機開太快或是突然煞車，乘客就有可能摔倒。

content.en: This year in Taipei, from January to May, almost one hundred bus riders were hurt! Every year in Taipei, about two hundred bus riders are hurt! Ow!
content.tw: 台北每年都有大約兩百位公車乘客因此受傷。

content.en: The bus drivers wanted to do a good job. But they worked many hours. Why? Taipei could not get more bus drivers.
content.tw: 台北的公車司機不夠，所以他們的工作時間很長、很累。

content.en: And the roads were busy. People were waiting at bus stops! The bus drivers tried not to be late!
content.tw: 塞車的時候，司機就會著急，因為他們不想讓大家在公車站等太久。司機一緊張，就容易發生意外！

content.en: But Taipei wants safer buses. Now there are more bus drivers. They cannot work more than ten hours a day.
content.tw: 為了讓乘客更安全，台北雇用了更多司機，減少司機疲勞駕駛的問題。

content.en: The roads are busy. People are waiting at bus stops. But Taipei will also teach bus drivers safer driving. And bus drivers can do a good job!
content.tw: 台北的公車司機需要學習如何安全駕駛。這樣一來，搭公車受傷的人就會變少。

content.en: Bus riders want safer buses. Falling is NOT fun!
content.tw: 公車乘客希望有更安全的公車。跌倒一點都不好玩！

vocabulary.preface: 台北市希望增加公車司機的人數，鼓勵大家多多搭乘。

content.text:
1. road 道路。
This road looks dangerous! 這條路看起來很危險!
You sure it's safe to drive this fast? 你確定可以開這麼快?

2. hurt 受傷的。
Relax, I'm the driver.別擔心，是我在開車。
No one's gonna get hurt.不會有人受傷的。
We should just take the bus.我們應該就搭公車的。

3. late 遲到。
Then we'd have to wait and wait. 那我們就得一直等。
I'm already late for work. 我上班已經晚了。
Your job doesn't pay enough for stunt driving.
你工作拿的錢可不夠你耍開車特技。

4. job 工作。
Maybe I can get a new job as a taxi driver. 也許我可以換新工作，當計程車司機。
You'll get fined every day! 你會每天都被罰錢的!

vocabulary.postscript: road道路 hurt受傷的 late遲到 job工作

quiz.question: 1. What do bus riders sometimes do when buses stop too fast?
2. How many bus riders were hurt from January to May in Taipei?
3. What will Taipei teach bus drivers?

content.en: Nature is everywhere! There are oceans, mountains, forests, animals, and much, much more. When you learn about nature, you can help keep it safe.
content.tw: 大自然無所不在，你要是對海洋，山脈或是動物有更多了解，就可以保護它們。

content.en: Playing in nature is a fun way to learn about it. You and your friends can walk in nature with a teacher. What can you see busy bugs doing? What animals can you see? Maybe… maybe… you can see a snake!
content.tw: 你可以跟朋友或是老師走進大自然，看看昆蟲，看看樹木花草。可能還會看到一條蛇!

content.en: Some nature walks are at night. You and your friends can walk in a forest with a teacher. Nature is around you. But you can't see much. So... listen carefully! Shhhhh!
content.tw: 有時候夜遊森林也很有趣。四周被樹木包圍了，什麼都看不清楚。那是什麼聲音...?

content.en: Maybe you'll hear this. That's a flying squirrel jumping to a new tree! What's that?! That's an owl! Wow! Taiwan doesn't have many. To help owls be safe, help make Earth cleaner. A clean Earth is good for all animals!
content.tw: 你也許會聽到飛鼠跳到另外一棵樹! 或者是貓頭鷹! 貓頭鷹在台灣並不常見，想保護牠們，就要減少對地球的汙染。

content.en: Hey! What's that? Is your teacher hungry? No! That's a frog! Taiwan has many kinds. Some live in trees! How cool!
content.tw: 咦，你的老師是不是餓了? 不對，是青蛙的叫聲。青蛙種類繁多，有的住在樹上。

content.en: Maybe you'll see frogs too! Wait! To keep them safe, don't touch them!
content.tw: 不要摸青蛙，牠們的皮膚很細緻，人類的手可能帶來傷害。

content.en: It's fun to play in nature and learn! Play and learn how to keep nature safe!
content.tw: 在大自然中玩耍和學習很有趣！盡情玩耍並學習如何保護大自然吧！

vocabulary.preface: 擺脫城市走進大自然，你會有不同的收穫。

content.text:
1. snake 蛇。
We should go camping this weekend. 我們這周末應該去露營。
I miss being in nature.我想念大自然。
Nature? 大自然?
The last time you saw a snake,你上次看到蛇,
you screamed and jumped around! 不但尖叫，還跳來跳去!

2. forest 森林。
Because that's one ugly snake! 因為那條蛇好醜!
That's what you get when you go into a forest. 你進入森林就會看到那些。

3. owl 貓頭鷹。
What I want to see are owls and other birds. 我想看的是貓頭鷹跟別的鳥類。

4. hear 聽到。
I want to hear the sounds of the forest at night. 我想聽森林在晚上的聲音。
Like wolves howling. 比如說狼嚎。
There are no wild wolves in Taiwan! 台灣沒有野生的狼!

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like nature?
來讀單字。snake蛇 forest森林 owl貓頭鷹 hear聽到

quiz.question: 1. What can you do when you learn about nature?
2. What do you do on a nature walk at night?
3. How can you help owls be safe?

title: Ducks Walk to Town for Bedtime

content.en: Every night near a small town in the U.K., some mama ducks and baby ducks go for a walk.
content.tw: 在英國的一個小鎮，每晚都有鴨媽媽帶著一群寶寶出來散步。

content.en: Twenty ducks leave their river together. They walk in two groups. They walk for fifteen minutes!
content.tw: 總共二十隻鴨子一起離開牠們白天待的小河流，搖搖擺擺往前走。

content.en: The ducks walk to town. They go to a parking lot. It has nice, warm stones. The ducks like it there.
content.tw: 走了15分鐘之後來到停車場。牠們很喜歡這裡，因為石頭地面溫暖舒服。

content.en: The ducks sit down. They stay close together. They sleep until morning. Then they walk back to the river.
content.tw: 鴨子們窩在一起，一路睡到早上。起床後，牠們便會走回河邊。

content.en: But these walks are not safe. Some time ago, four ducks got hurt. Cars hit them. That was very sad. The cars were going fast. The drivers did not see the ducks.
content.tw: 這段路非常危險。曾經有四隻鴨子在過馬路時不幸被汽車撞上。

content.en: Now kind people help the ducks. Fifteen people take turns. They wear colorful clothes. Cars can see them. They walk with the ducks. They stop cars for the ducks. They watch the ducks sleep. They keep the ducks safe!
content.tw: 現在有志工團隊負責指揮交通，幫助鴨子過馬路。這些友善的志工晚上會輪流守護鴨子，確保他們能睡得安穩！

content.en: Today, no more ducks are hurt. They walk from June to December. Every night, they come. Every morning, they go.
content.tw: 如今，沒有鴨子受傷，他們能安全的走在路上！

content.en: The ducks walk happily to and from their place in the parking lot. And people smile!
content.tw: 鴨子們高興地來回走動於牠們在停車場的棲息地。人們也為此微笑！

vocabulary.preface: 這群鴨子找到晚上睡覺的地方，會自己走過去。

content.text:
1. car 汽車.
Do you walk to your car from the office every night?
你每天晚上都從辦公室走去你的車?
Sure, but I wish I had a driver. 當然，但是真希望我有司機。

2. safe 安全的.
I can walk you there tonight. 我今晚可以陪你走。
To keep me safe? 保護我安全嗎?
Yeah, two is better than one.對啊，兩個總比一個好。

3. parking lot 停車場.
But it's a safe parking lot. 不過那個停車場很安全。
Uh-huh, you just need a ride, right? 你是想搭便車，對吧?

4. sleep 睡覺.
You got me. 被你抓到了。
So please don't sleep while driving.所以你開車時可別睡著。
Maybe you can be my driver? 也許你可以當我的司機?
No, I need to sleep. 不行，我需要睡覺。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你可記住了?
car汽車 safe安全的 parking lot停車場 sleep睡覺

quiz.question: 1. When do the ducks go to the parking lot?
2. How many people help the ducks?
3. What hurt four ducks before?
options: b. Stones in the parking lot

title: Wild Mushrooms Can Make You Sick

content.en: Mushrooms love rainy and humid weather. Taiwan is often rainy and humid. Wild mushrooms grow everywhere here! You might see them in the mountains, on farms or fields, at school, or in your backyard.
content.tw: 台灣氣候潮濕，非常適合野生菇類的生長。這些菇類會長在山上、農場上、也可能從你家後院的泥土中冒出來！

content.en: Mmmmm! Wild mushrooms look good to eat. But some are very bad to eat. Which are good to eat? Which are bad? It's hard to know! So Taiwan is telling everyone not to eat wild mushrooms.
content.tw: 有些野菇可以吃，有些不能吃，但他們很難分辨。所以政府提醒大家不要亂吃野菇！

content.en: In Kaohsiung, some big wild mushrooms were growing next to a road. Some were bigger than a hand! People stopped their cars to look. Maybe some wanted to eat these wild mushrooms!
content.tw: 有人在高雄的路邊發現了很大的野菇！也許會有人想吃吃看。

content.en: The police came. They took the mushrooms away. They wanted to keep everyone safe!
content.tw: 為了確保大家的安全，警察把那些大雨之後長出來的野菇都清除了。

content.en: Wild mushrooms can make you very sick. They can make your stomach hurt a lot. They can make you have diarrhea. They can make you throw up.
content.tw: 有些野生的蕈菇有毒！亂吃野菇的話可能會肚子痛或是嘔吐！

content.en: If you eat wild mushrooms and get sick, don't wait to get better. Go to the doctor!
content.tw: 如果你吃到野菇之後身體不舒服，就一定要去看醫生！

content.en: So remember: don't eat wild mushrooms. They look good but they can be very bad for you!
content.tw: 所以記住：不要吃野生蘑菇。它們看起來很好，但對你來說可能非常糟糕！

vocabulary.preface: 路邊的野菇不能隨便撿起來吃。

content.text: 1. grow 種植。 I plan to grow some white button mushrooms. 我打算種一些蘑菇。 Mushrooms! I love mushrooms stir fried with shrimps. 蘑菇! 我愛吃蘑菇炒蝦仁。
2) weather 天氣。 Then you must come to my house and eat them. 那你一定要來我家來吃。 Yeah, if you succeed. 好啊，要是你種成功的話。 Of course I will! 我當然會。 It's easy in this humid weather.天氣這麼潮濕，很容易的。
3) wild 野生的。 I've seen wild mushrooms in the grass after it rained. 我看過下雨之後草地上就有野菇。 Those may be dangerous. 那些可能有危險。
4) sick 生病的。 I know. That's why I didn't dare touch them. 我知道，這是為什麼我碰都不敢碰。 I don't want to get sick. 我可不想生病。

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡蘑菇嗎?來一起讀單字。 grow種植 weather天氣 wild野生的 sick生病的

quiz.question: 1. What kind of weather do mushrooms like?
2. What is Taiwan telling everyone about wild mushrooms?
3. What did the police do to some wild mushrooms in Kaohsiung?

title: Farmer Says Goodbye to Buffalo, Hello to Machines

content.en: In sunny Taitung, a farmer is working. He loves to work on his farm!
content.tw: 在陽光普照的台東，一位農夫正在工作。他熱愛他的農場工作！

content.en: The farmer grows rice. It is called "Ugly Beauty." Well, this kind of rice is not pretty! But he likes it a lot. It tastes good!
content.tw: 有一個農夫在台東種植稻米，他種的米叫做「醜美人」。這種米不好看，但很好吃！

content.en: For many years, the farmer had water buffalo. Water buffalo look like cows. They are big and strong.
content.tw: 這名農夫很多年來都用高大強壯的水牛耕田。

content.en: His water buffalo worked on the farm. They worked very hard. They helped the farmer turn the soil. This helped the rice grow better!
content.tw: 農夫的水牛辛苦種田、翻土，讓米長得越來越好。

content.en: But the farmer was getting older. Farming was getting harder and harder for him.
content.tw: 但農夫年紀越來越大，對他來說，務農變得越來越困難。

content.en: Then he was eighty. He wanted to keep farming. But it was too hard. The farmer said goodbye to his water buffalo. He was sad.
content.tw: 但農夫年紀太大了，沒辦法再種田。他難過的跟他的水牛道別。

content.en: Then the farmer's children came to help! They gave him machines for the farm too. The machines made farming easier!
content.tw: 農夫的小孩來幫忙，也給老爸爸買來機器，讓種田更輕鬆。

content.en: The farmer was happy! His children and the machines helped him keep farming!
content.tw: 農夫不再難過。因為有了孩子與機器的幫忙，他就能繼續耕田了！

content.en: Now the Ugly Beauty rice farmer is 91 years old. He smiles every day. He loves farming!
content.tw: 現在這位醜美人稻米農夫已經91歲了。他每天都面帶微笑。他熱愛農耕！

vocabulary.preface: 農夫和水牛是好朋友，不過機器漸漸取代了牛的地位。

content.text:
1. harder and harder 越來越難。
It's getting harder and harder for me to get up early.我越來越沒辦法早起。

2. easier 更容易。
Why? 為什麼?
It's easier for me as the sun rises early. 我覺得日出提早了，更容易早起。
That's my problem. 這正是我的問題。

3. keep 持續。
I just don't like getting up with the sun. 我就是不愛跟著太陽起床.
And your bed keeps making you stay longer. 你的床也一直讓你想多待一會兒。

4. sad 悲傷的。
Exactly! 正是那樣!
What should I do? 怎麼辦?
Think of something happy when you wake up. 醒來時想一些快樂的事.
But my dreams are often sad. 但是我都做悲傷的夢。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字?
harder and harder越來越難 easier更容易 keep持續 happy快樂的

2. What did the farmer's water buffalo do?
3. How old is the farmer now?

content.en: There's something old and new in Taipei! It's the new National Railway Museum. You can learn about Taiwan's old trains. Go and see it with your family!
content.tw: 國家鐵道博物館要開幕囉！你可以在那邊看到早期的火車。

content.en: Before, the museum was a big railway workshop. Workers fixed trains there for many years. But that was a long time ago.
content.tw: 好久以前，這座博物館是一個維修火車的工廠。

content.en: The workshop is very old. But many people worked hard to make it look nice. They cleaned the walls. They painted the doors. They cleaned the old tools and machines. They did this for nine years!
content.tw: 原本老舊的工廠需要翻新。整修與裝潢花了整整九年才完成！

content.en: Now the museum is ready. There are lots of things to see. There are twenty-four old trains. Their wheels are very big.
content.tw: 大功告成之後，博物館現在總共有二十四台以前的火車！

content.en: The workshop has tools, machines, and train parts. The old office has papers and cool maps. The maps show where the trains went.
content.tw: 博物館的工作室展出各種機器跟火車零件。辦公室裡面則有公文跟畫了火車路線的地圖。

content.en: On some days, an old bright blue train is ready to go! You can ride it! You will hear the loud horn. You will hear the engine. You will feel the train go faster and faster!
content.tw: 有時候，參觀的遊客甚至還可以搭一段藍色的火車，聽到火車鳴笛的聲音，感受到火車越跑越快。

content.en: Go and see the National Railway Museum. You'll have a great train day!
content.tw: 快去參觀國家鐵道博物館吧。你將會度過美好的一天！

vocabulary.preface: 台北市國家鐵道博物館，讓很多火車迷大為興奮!

content.text:
1. train 火車。
Are you interested in trains? 你對火車有興趣嗎?
You're going to take me on a train trip? 你要帶我坐火車旅行?
No, I'm planning to go to a railway museum. 不是，我打算去鐵道博物館。

2. museum 博物館。
And you'd like me to go with you? 你想要我一起去?
If you want to. 要是你想去的話。
What's in the museum? 博物館裡有什麼?

3. fix 修理。
Lots of trains. 很多火車。
You'll get to see how workers fixed the trains. 你會看到工人怎麼修理火車。
I prefer to go on a train trip. 我比較想搭火車旅行。

4. national 國家的。
Let's go take the Bong Bong Train at Taiping National Forest this weekend.
我們這周末去太平山國家森林坐蹦蹦車!
And the museum? 那博物館呢?

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡搭火車嗎?
train火車 museum博物館 fix修理 national國家的

2. Where are the papers and maps?
3. What color is the train you can ride?

title: A Cool New Aquarium Opens in Taiwan

content.en: Do you like to see fish and other ocean animals? Well, there's a great new aquarium in Taichung!
content.tw: 台中現在有一座新的水族館！

content.en: At Taichung Aquarium, you can get close to the animals. You can see them! You can hear them! You can smell them! You can touch some! You can - oh, wait, don't taste them, please…
content.tw: 你可以在台中水族館跟動物互動，還可以用耳朵聽，用鼻子聞，有一些用手摸，但是拜託別吃牠們！

content.en: The aquarium has five floors. On the first floor, you are in an ocean. A very big ocean tank there has sharks, rays, and more cool ocean animals!
content.tw: 水族館有五層樓。一樓是海洋生物區，除了有鯊魚跟魟魚，還有更多很酷的海洋生物！

content.en: On the second floor, you can see cute penguins walking close to you. On the third floor, you can learn about a river in Taichung.
content.tw: 在二樓，你可以看到可愛的企鵝走來走去。三樓的展覽則介紹一條台中的河流。

content.en: On the fourth floor, you take off your shoes. Then you can walk in a wetland. What? Yes, it's Taiwan's first indoor wetland!
content.tw: 到四樓後，你可以脫掉鞋子，踩一踩全台灣第一個搬進室內的濕地！

content.en: The aquarium also helps sick or hurt ocean animals get better. And it teaches people that leaving pet animals in nature is NOT a good idea!
content.tw: 水族館也幫助生病或是受傷的動物。他們也提醒大家不要放生寵物回到大自然。

content.en: Taichung Aquarium's ocean animals are waiting for you! Come and see, hear, smell, and touch them!
content.tw: 台中水族館的海洋動物們正在等著你！快來看看、聽聽、聞聞並觸摸牠們！

vocabulary.preface: 水族館是非常好玩的地方，可以看到各種有趣的生物。

content.text:
1. penguin 企鵝。
I've ranked my favorite animals.我把最喜歡的動物排了名次。
Oh? Let's hear it. 我聽聽看。
First place is the penguin.第一名是企鵝。

2. shark 鯊魚。
The second one is the shark.第二名是鯊魚。
Shark?! The shark is not cute.鯊魚? 鯊魚不可愛。
It's not. But I like it.的確，不過我喜歡。

3. third 第三個。
Okay, and the third one? 好吧，第三名呢?
It's fish.是魚。
You like fish because you like to eat it, right?
你喜歡魚是因為喜歡吃它，對吧?

4. fish 魚。
Fish tastes good, don't you think? 魚很好吃，你不覺得嗎?
I do. I just hope you won't eat penguins.我同意，我只希望你別吃企鵝。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like seafood? 來讀單字。penguin企鵝 shark鯊魚 third第三個
fish魚
